Line 172: Line 172:
VinylDisc is the hybrid of a standard Audio CD and the [[Gramophone record|vinyl record]]. The vinyl layer on the disc's label side can hold approximately three minutes of music.
VinylDisc is the hybrid of a standard Audio CD and the [[Gramophone record|vinyl record]]. The vinyl layer on the disc's label side can hold approximately three minutes of music.

=== Bootable CD ==
+
=== Bootable CD ===
{{Main|Live CD}}
{{Main|Live CD}}
A bootable CD, or Live CD, is a CD that can be used to [[Booting|boot]] a computer system. The CD can contain an operating system installer (eg. Windows 2000, Windows XP), or even a full usable operating system, very common in the [[Linux]] world, with most distros, like [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] or [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]] offering fully usable Live CDs.
A bootable CD, or Live CD, is a CD that can be used to [[Booting|boot]] a computer system. The CD can contain an operating system installer (eg. Windows 2000, Windows XP), or even a full usable operating system, very common in the [[Linux]] world, with most distros, like [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] or [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]] offering fully usable Live CDs.
